Articles.Content:
1 minute ago, AHeroReborn said:

so sorry

Ill just hack my space module into a 1.1 KM encounter, because I have a maneuver node with that distance...
i already put up the new file
Then Ill make another one...

Docked...

On launchpad...

In space...

Near Encounter...

Docked...
@Galacticvoyager I think you might have missed the seven part rule.

Just now, Ultimate Steve said:

@Galacticvoyager I think you might have missed the seven part rule.

Wait, there was a seven part rule? Never saw it, too late now anyways...
wherd my piece go in those pics?

19 minutes ago, Galacticvoyager said:

Wait, there was a seven part rule? Never saw it, too late now anyways...

also im terribly sorry i messed you up, but you were supposed to tell us you were launching.
I think he didn't quite read the OP. Please read the OP and try again @Galacticvoyager
why is there a part count rule?

Just now, AHeroReborn said:

why is there a part count rule?

In the old CSS the station got really huge. The 7 part restriction was added to reduce lag and make it so everyone could contribute.

The rule is to allow more modules to be added without majorly impacting performance.

edit: I got ninja'd 

Edited February 18, 2017 by 53miner53
The station core has more than 7 parts. I don't see the 7 part rule as well. So you can't take my contribution off...
Station core has 2 clamp o tron senior docking ports, 1 probe core, 1 4K battery pack, and 3 solar panels. Total 7 parts. The other modules should have 7 parts each as well.

There is a mk3 fuel storages, the 3 clamp-o-torn seniors, the engine cluster connection part and then the crew cabins.

7 parts is ridiculously small, you need RCS to dock with a space station or else you would yave trouble trying to oreintate your craft to dock using a booster.

 Leave mine as a exception, it's too late now and if you take mine out, after all this hard work, then I'll be angry with you. Also, I did not see the rule, hell I just read the rules and there isn't a 7 part rule.

Technically it's listed as a 5 part rule plus 2 clamp o tron seniors, but the point still stands. Someone else's module was in the process of being added to the station while you did your module, but they had read the rules, so I would like to politely ask you to add a module to the station that has 5 parts or less as well as 1-2 clamp o tron sr docking ports. For docking, I would recommend having a service module with RCS control, and using that to dock.
One of the ideas of this challenge is using detachable RCS pods, or using a tug module (which we could waive the 7 part rule a little bit to have a dedicated tug).

this is looking cool!

For the seven part rule @Galacticvoyager, if you need RCS you should use detachable tugs like @Ultimate Steve mentioned. This means you can have 2 RCS tanks. with the RCS blocks attached to them, not the module, and after docking the module just jettison the two tugs so that you can have them either become debris or you/someone else can bring it back into the atmosphere so it will burn up.

Edited February 19, 2017 by nascarlaser1
ooh, i amy need to restart as well because i have RCS on the station

2 hours ago, AHeroReborn said:

ooh, i amy need to restart as well because i have RCS on the station

We can have RCS on the station, so long as the module has 5 parts including the RCS and an additional 2 docking ports.

Edited February 19, 2017 by 53miner53
okay, im relaunching with Unattached Rcs blocks
Are things other than adding to the station allowed? I'm talking things like building bases on other planets, stations around them, and creating satellite networks.

4 hours ago, Fireheart318 said:

Are things other than adding to the station allowed? I'm talking things like building bases on other planets, stations around them, and creating satellite networks.

Just my input here, I'm following the thread and may or may not end up contributing, but I think it would be pretty cool to do this, maybe with similar rules to the station, but with a bigger part limit, considering that less people are likely to add to a base on another planet/moon, or in another SOI? Not that my opinion carries much weight , I just think it'd be pretty cool... Maybe double the part limit for bases, but have a standard docking port height (to avoid docking difficulties) and two rovers (to perform the duties of tugs for new modules), and a rule that any landers must be removed, either from the tracking station before reuploading the save, or launched back into space and left there (artificial planet rings from debris are cool, right?) Just my two cents. Maybe also double the limit for stations in other SOI's (depending on the difficulty of a rendezvous?) Just a thought.

 

EDIT: Also, screenshots plez guys, I really want to see how cool all your additions to the station are, being too lazy to download the save myself... (at the moment)

Edited February 20, 2017 by Espresso

I think that is what the community space program does. I wouldn't be against the idea, but the challenge is already there so I don't think we should do that here. If that challenge dies out then I will certainly try to remember this idea and start it over here.

edit: turns out the community space program died out last month, so I'll add a Mun space station to the save file for people to add to once they've added to the LKO station. We will add other stations and bases one by one. 

Edited February 20, 2017 by 53miner53

4 hours ago, 53miner53 said:

I think that is what the community space program does. I wouldn't be against the idea, but the challenge is already there so I don't think we should do that here. If that challenge dies out then I will certainly try to remember this idea and start it over here.

edit: turns out the community space program died out last month, so I'll add a Mun space station to the save file for people to add to once they've added to the LKO station. We will add other stations and bases one by one. 

Sounds good, but maybe consider popping a few more stations and bases out there for the time being (just one or two maybe), just so anyone taking part has a bit of choice as to where they're sending a module. It's your choice, but I think that'd be pretty cool... Other than that, it's pretty cool to be adding bases slowly anyway (If you want, I might get a chance this weekend (or tonight, maybe) to whip up a core module and a few rovers for a mun base, so people can pick between moon base module and mun station module, and then I could send it off to the mun if you want.)
